edge: Rajeev falls in love with Roopa after hearing her sing at the village temple, but has not yet seen her disfigured side.
Roopa lives with her father, the village priest.
Part of Roopa's face and neck were burned by a pot of boiling oil as a child, leaving her right cheek disfigured.
After the accident, Roopa keeps her right cheek hidden under the veil of her sari.
Despite her disfigurement, Roopa remains religious and goes to the village temple daily, singing hymns and devotional songs.
Rajeev asks Roopa's father for permission to marry her after hearing her sing at the village temple.
Roopa does not want to cheat Rajeev because she loves him deeply and first requests his father to reject the marriage proposal.
Roopa lives in a village.
Rajeev arrives in the village to oversee the operation of a major dam.
Rajeev is working on a dam in the village.
Rajeev abhors anything ugly, but has not yet seen Roopa's disfigured side.
After seeing Roopa's lovely singing, Rajeev falls in love with her and does not see her disfigured side.
Rajeev asks Roopa's father for permission to marry her after falling in love with her.
Roopa does not want to cheat Rajeev because she loves him deeply and first requests his father to reject the marriage proposal.
After everyone from the village requests Roopa to change her mind, she agrees to marry Rajeev thinking he may accept her with her condition as he claimed to love her truly.
After the wedding, Rajeev discovers Roopa's disfigured side and thinks he was cheated and forced to marry someone else.
After discovering Roopa's disfigured side, Rajeev disowns her and drives her out of the house.
After driving Roopa out of the house, Rajeev roams around the village on the wedding night in search of another Roopa.
